PREGUNTA.Texto: When was the first maned moon landing?
What was the name of the first maned starship which landed on the moon?
Who was the knight of the white moon?
what is the age of the Moon?
How long is a day at the Moon?
How far is the Moon from us?
PREGUNTA.Error3: So far we cannot see it

PREGUNTA.Texto: How many football camps are the Moon's circumference?
PREGUNTA.Error2: A football camp is bigger than Moon's circumference

PREGUNTA.Texto: How many olympic swimming pools are the Moon's circumference?

INFORMACION.Cuerpo: The first maned Moon landing was in 1969, by the spaceship Apolo 11. The crew was formed by Neil A.Armstrong, Edwin E.Aldrin Jr.and Michael Collins.When Armstrong stepped on the Moon he said one of the most famous quotes of the history of the mankind: 'That is one small step for man, one giant leap for mankind'.
The Moon has appeared in a lot of famous stories, for example, Don Quijote of the Mancha was called The Knight of the White Moon.
The Moon was born 4.530.000.000 years ago, she keeps herself young, uh?.
A day on the Moon lasts almost a month on the Earth, exactly 27.322 Earth days
Have you ever think in travelling to the Moon? Moon is approximately 405,000 kilometers far from the Earth. It is like 10 times the circumference of Earth. Do you still want to travel to the Moon?
The circumference of the Moon is 10,917 km. That is equivalent to 0.272719 times the circumference of the Earth, 109.170 football camps and 21.940 Olympic swimming pools.

The weight of the Moon is 73.476.730.924.573.500.000.000 kg. That is equivalent to 0.0123 times the weight of the Earth, 13.672.633.220.054.614.812 African elephants and 1.224.612.182.076.225.000 Egipcian pyramid stones.
